meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a ghost or spirit.
meanings.sent1: The old, abandoned house had a spookish atmosphere that sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent2: The Halloween decorations gave the party a spookish feel.
meanings.sent3: The spookish sound of the wind howling outside made the children giggle nervously.
meanings.sent4: Her pale face and flowing white dress made her look spookish, like a ghost from a storybook.
meanings.sent5: The graveyard at night was so spookish that even the bravest souls hesitated to enter.

meanings.sent1: The dark alley looked spookish, making me walk faster to get out.
meanings.sent2: The sudden loud noise was spookish and made everyone jump.
meanings.sent3: The spookish shadow on the wall turned out to be just a playful cat.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the forest felt spookish, as if something was watching.
meanings.sent5: The creaking floorboards in the old house had a spookish effect on the visitors.

meanings.definition: To act in a secretive or mysterious manner.
meanings.sent1: She liked to spookishly sneak up on her friends and surprise them.
meanings.sent2: The detective decided to spookishly follow the suspect to gather more clues.
meanings.sent3: The magician spookishly made the rabbit disappear and reappear in his hat.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious stranger spookishly vanished into the fog before anyone could approach.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled as they spookishly hid behind the bushes, waiting to scare their friend.
